One day in Prague discover Prague, solve a cipher Discover the beauty of the city of 100 towers and magical athmosphere. Every place can give you a key for a secret cipher.
write your name Adventurous journey starts now!
//Title of In one day you can expect
//Fact 1 \u25CF Matka měst
//Fact 2 \u25CF Město sto věží
//Fact 3 \u25CF Magická atmosféra
//Fact 4 \u25CF Srdce Evropy

1. Wenceslas Square
The trip starts at Prague cultural, social and commercial center. Visit: National Museum, St. Wenceslas Statue, Lucerna Palace.
Key: What are the names of Czech patrons on the St. Wenceslas Statue? Wenceslas, Agnes, John of Nepomuk Wenceslas, Cyril, Methodius, Vitus, Adalbert Wenceslas, Peter, Pavel Ludmila, Agnes, Prokop, Adalbert
From the bottom part of Wenceslas Square go down through the street Na Můstku to the next point.
2. Old Town Square
The historical center of Prague. Visit: Old-town town-hall, Astronomical Clock, Church of Our Lady before Týn, St. Nicholas\' Church, Kinský Palace, Jan Hus Memorial.
Key: How often can you see apostles in the windows of the Astronomical Clock? Every hour Every day at the noon Every day at 6, 12, 18 and 24 hour Only on New Year
From the Astronomical Clock go to the Malé náměstí and then through the Karlova street and follow the directions to the next point.
3. Charles Bridge
The second oldest bridge in the Czech Republic from 1357. The most known among 30 Prague bridges with 30 amazing statues. Visit: Old Town Bridge Tower, Lesser Town Bridge Towers and take a look at bridge statues.
Key: How many pillars does Charles Bridge have? 12 13 15 16
On the right side you can see the next point - Prague Castle. Follow the directiones to the next point.
4. Prague Castle
The biggest old castle in the world with area of 7.28 ha, where the president resides. Visit: St. Vitus Cathedral, Old Royal Palace, Golden Lane, Powder Tower, gardens and changing of the Castle Guards every hour.
Key: The construction of St. Vitus Cathedral started in 1344. When was it finished? 1929 1561 1770 1385
Return to Charles Bridge and go down to the Kampa Island.
5. Kampa Island
Prague Venice, the second most beautiful city island of the world. Visit: Čertovka (Devil\'s Channel), Werich Villa, Sova\'s Mills (Museum Kampa), Babies.
Key: After which famous person is named a wall near to the Kampa Island? W. A. Mozart John Lennon king Karel IV. Albert Einstein
"At the end of the island go to Legie Bride to the last point. "
6. Slavia Café
Our journey ends across from the National Theather in the well-known café, which will give you the last key to the cipher. Visit: Have a cup of great coffee with strudel and from a window you can remember the beautiful places you have visited.
Key: Which famous people have visited Slavia Café? president Václav Havel Hillary Clinton Franz Kafka J. W. Goethe
CORRECT, the key is yours! Try it again. Write your name above.
THANK YOU, that you went with us to discover these beautiful places in the heart of Europe - magical Prague.
thanksMessage !BRAVO! The secret cipher is the VLTAVA and that is why our journey finishes right here. The VLTAVA, with its length of 430.2 km, is the longest river in the Czech Republic.
